titles.title: Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act
A bill to establish the Kate Mullany National Historic Site in the State of New York, and for other purposes.
Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act
Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act
Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act
Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 108-278.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Domenici with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 108-295.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 614.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Mr. Gibbons moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1241.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the Senate reported version is repeated here.)
Kate Mullany National Historic Site Act - Establishes the Kate Mullany National Historic Site in Troy, New York. Authorizes appropriations.
